Hardliners, who prioritized social stability and the preservation of the one-party system, clashed with reformists who advocated for greater political openness and economic liberalization.
- **Role of the "Cultural Revolution" Legacy**: The trauma of the Cultural Revolution (1966–1976) and the subsequent rehabilitation of its victims in the late 1970s and 1980s influenced party politics.
